title: 2 Highly-Ranked Stocks to Buy in August and Hold
text: Here are two highly-ranked Zacks stocks that have climbed to new highs in July that investors might want to buy in August.

title: Amazon stock plummets on revenue miss, guides lower on Q3: should you buy or sell?
text: Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) shares plunged more than 7% on Friday, creating a downward price gap. The company announced its fiscal Q2 results on Thursday after markets closed, beating analyst expectations on earnings but missing on revenue.

title: Is Big Tech Growth Really Decelerating?
text: Tesla has been criticized for not being able to generate significant profits in the foreseeable future. The last quarter proved that this is not the case. It's normal to expect the company will generate more profit in the future.

title: Amazon earnings reveal fundamental shift: Total services revenue on track to surpass retail sales
text: Direct retail sales are poised to represent less than half of Amazon's business for the first time in its history — a fundamental shift that reflects the e-commerce giant's expansion beyond its roots as an online store.

title: Amazon plunge drags down eBay, Etsy and Wayfair as investors fret over slowing growth
text: Amazon's disappointing results on Thursday pushed down shares of top U.S. e-commerce companies.

title: US stocks close down as Amazon tanks on revenue miss
text: 4:05pm: US equities close down to end July trading US stocks closed down to mark the end of July trading amid a steep decline in Amazon shares.   The e-commerce giant tanked 7.6% after it reported its first quarterly revenue miss in three years and gave weaker guidance.

title: US stocks slip as weak Amazon sales outlook highlights growth challenges for tech giants
text: "We think Amazon remains in a solid position, with US retail growth likely above industry growth rates," BofA analysts said.

title: Stocks end lower after Amazon disappointment, but S&P 500 logs 6th straight monthly gain
text: Stocks fell Friday, leaving major averages negative for the week but still holding monthly gains as July trading came to a close. Equities were pressured after e-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc. late Thursday delivered disappointing quarterly results.

title: Forecast eCommerce trends predicted for Amazon will beat expectations in 2021
text: Amazon sales blew past our pre-pandemic expectations for 2020, and it will beat total sales expectations again in 2021.

title: Here's Why Amazon Stock Plunged Today
text: And why it could be the buying opportunity investors have been waiting for.

title: Amazon faces more than slowing sales growth: it needs more warehouses
text: Amazon.com Inc needs to spend billions of dollars to expand its warehouse and delivery system, adding pressure to its shares which dropped 7% on Friday after it forecast lower sales growth.

title: Amazon and Other Online Retailers Swoon on Slower E-Commerce Growth
text: Amazon wants Wall Street to think about it over a two-year span, rather than focusing on year-over-year comparisons given the distortions created by the pandemic.

title: Amazon Q2 Earnings Disappoint: ETFs in Focus
text: Amazon missed revenue estimates for the first time in three quarters and offered weak third-quarter guidance though it beat on the bottom line.

title: Wall Street a sea of red as Amazon earnings disappointment weighs on stocks
text: 12.10pm: Wall Street still well in the red Investors saw a sea of red on Wall Street at the midday point of trading after weaker-than-expected earnings from heavyweights like Amazon. Particularly hurting was the Nasdaq, nearly 0.72% off of its opening levels at 14,672, a loss of nearly 107 points.

title: Amazon delivery companies routinely tell drivers to bypass safety inspections
text: Amazon urges drivers not to "operate any unsafe vehicles" but drivers say managers encourage them to ignore safety hazards during daily inspections.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Q2 Earnings Top Estimates, Sales Rise Y/Y
text: Amazon's (AMZN) second-quarter results reflect strength across Prime and AWS.

title: Amazon, Mastercard, Pinterest and More Friday Afternoon Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades
text: With the trading day nearly halfway over, the broad markets were pulling back into the weekend.

title: Amazon Stock Loses $130 Billion In Market Value After $885 Million Fine And Dismal Earnings Report
text: The company's stock is on track for its worst day in more than a year.

title: The Ratings Game: ‘A great time to buy,' says one Wall Street analyst as Amazon shares tumble on disappointment
text: Shares of Amazon.com sank 7% in Friday trading, but analysts were not rushing to downgrade the e-commerce giant as brick-and-mortar competition hit its results.

title: EU Data Watchdog Slaps €746M Penalty On Amazon
text: On July 16, the Luxembourg National Commission for Data Protection (the CNPD) held Amazon.com Inc's (NASDAQ: AMZN) Amazon Europe Core S.à r.l. for not complying with the personal data processing under the EU General Data Protection Regulation.

title: Amazon hit by record EU data privacy fine
text: Amazon.com Inc shares hit their lowest level for months as investors deserted the online giant after a disappointing earnings upgrade overnight and a huge EU fine today. Luxembourg regulators {CNPD)  fined Jeff Bezos's old firm €746mln for breaches of EU General Data Protection Rules, which the company said was without merit and that it intends to defend vigorously.

title: EU hits Amazon with record-breaking $887M GDPR fine over data misuse
text: Luxembourg's National Commission for Data Protection (CNPD) has hit Amazon with a record-breaking €746 million ($887m) GDPR fine over the way it uses customer data for targeted advertising purposes. Amazon disclosed the ruling in an SEC filing on Friday in which it slammed the decision as baseless and added that it intended to defend itself […]

title: Amazon fined 746 mn euros in Luxembourg over data privacy
text: Amazon was fined 746 million euros ($880 million) by Luxembourg authorities over allegations it flouted the EU's data protection rules, the online retail giant said Friday.

title: AMZN vs WMT Weekly: Amazon's Decelerating Sales Could Be An Opening For Walmart
text: After another record Prime Day in June and months of investment in its logistics network, Amazon would historically have joined its retail compatriots in beating Wall Street earnings expectations this week. But with consumers emerging from their homes to shop and socialize, therefore spending less time shopping online, Amazon missed sales expectations — a rare […]

title: Munster explains why investors were unimpressed of Amazon's Q2 results
text: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) reported weaker than expected sales for its fiscal second-quarter last night that fuelled a sell-off in the stock. Shares of the company opened about 7% down on Friday morning.

title: Bears Blast Plummeting Amazon Stock After Revenue Miss
text: The shares of Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) are down 6.7% at $3,357.99 this morning, following the company's second-quarter  earnings call.

title: Amazon on pace for worst day since March 2020 after earnings disappoint
text: Investors acknowledged the slower growth could put Amazon's stock under pressure in the near term, but said they remain positive about the e-commerce market.

title: Stocks open lower, with Nasdaq down 0.9% after Amazon results disappoint
text: Stocks opened lower Friday, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite leading major averages to the downside after disappointing quarterly results from online-retailing juggernaut Amazon.com Inc. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 64 points, or 0.2%, at 35,021, while the S&P 500 declined 0.6% to 4,393.34. The Nasdaq dropped 0.9% to 14,645.47.

title: Amazon Stock Drops 7.2% As Andy Jassy Presides Over Slower Growth
text: Amazon forecasts 13% revenue growth -- the lowest in 20 years. Unless the delta variant sends us back to lockdown, Amazon's future value depends on whether CEO Andy Jassy can build a bridge back to 27% growth.

title: AMZN Stock Fell Over 7% Pre-Market: Why It Happened
text: The stock price of Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) fell over 7% pre-market. This is why it happened.

title: Amazon Sinks, Chevron Pops, and the Nasdaq Is Down
text: All three of the major U.S. stock indexes were weaker. Stock in Amazon.com fell after the online retailer reported lower sales than expected.

title: Amazon has been fined a record $887 million for violating data privacy rules in Europe
text: Luxembourg's data protection authority claimed Amazon's processing of personal data did not comply with EU law.

title: Amazon hit with $887 million fine by EU privacy watchdog
text: The fine, disclosed by Amazon on Friday in a securities filing, was issued two weeks ago by Luxembourg's privacy regulator.

title: What's Going On With Amazon's Stock Today?
text: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) is trading lower Friday morning after the company announced worse-than-expected second-quarter financial results and issued guidance below estimates. Amazon reported quarterly earnings of $15.12 per share, which beat the estimate of $12.22 per share.

title: Amazon Stock Gets Crushed After Earnings: A Technical Take
text: After a disappointing earnings report, shares of Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) are trading much lower Friday morning. Yesterday's closing price was $3,599.95 and share are trading around the $3,350 level, a loss of almost 7%.

title: Amazon Craters After Earnings Beat. It Usually Does That.
text: Amazon stock is dropping after beating earnings estimates, something that happens quite frequently. Why earnings reports are rarely thesis-changing.

title: Amazon hit with $888 million fine by EU privacy watchdog
text: The fine, disclosed by Amazon on Friday in a securities filing, was issued two weeks ago by Luxembourg's privacy regulator.

title: Amazon hit with $886 million EU data privacy fine
text: Amazon.com Inc has been hit with an $886.55 million (746 million euro) European Union fine for processing personal data in violation of the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the e-commerce giant said on Friday.

title: Amazon Stock Sell-Off: A Buying Opportunity?
text: The market may be overreacting to the e-commerce giant's revenue miss, giving investors a good buying opportunity.

title: Amazon Vs. Facebook Vs. Google: How The Tech Giants Fared Against Each Other On Ad-Revenue In Latest Quarter
text: Amazon.com Inc's (NASDAQ: AMZN) advertising business grew the most in two-and-a-half years in the second quarter amid stiff competition, outpacing the growth of key tech rivals Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG)  and Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB). What Happened: The e-commerce giant's advertising revenue, which is gradually turning out to be a key source of growth for the company as momentum in other businesses slows, grew a whopping 87% year-over-year to $7.9 billion in the quarter ended June 30.

title: Glum Amazon earnings drag Nasdaq futures down 1% ahead of inflation data
text: Nasdaq futures fell 1% on Friday after an underwhelming quarterly earnings report from Amazon.com, while investors looked to a key inflation report for cues on the pace of a domestic economic recovery.

title: Amazon tumbles 7% premarket, after missing sales estimates for the first time since 2018 as the pandemic boom cooled
text: Amazon's sales jumped 27% year-on-year to $113 billion but missed Wall Street estimates, disappointing investors.

title: Market Snapshot: U.S. stock futures drop with Nasdaq poised to tumble after Amazon disappoints
text: The final trading day of July was setting up as a tough one, with investors weighing up disappointing results from ecommerce giant Amazon.com.
